Since 3.2M6, there is a problem with this function. The output for the mac plateform is made of the usual configuration and plugins folder, the startup.jar file but the package "AppName.app" is not there. Instead there is two files one named "Eclipse" and the other"AppName" but they are  not executable. There is also a folder named "MacOS".... looks like there is a lack of regrouping all these into a working executable package.

I am not sure about the linux exports but the windows export is correct.
I am using Eclipse SDK 3.2M6 along with a target made of RCP-SDK 3.2M6 and the Delta-Pack 3.2M6 on Mac OS X 10.4.6 using Java 1.4.2.
Are you trying to export an RCP app?
Yes. Did I post the bug in the wrong place ?
The problem is coming from the delta pack itself that is misshaped. More precisely the launcher files the MacOs folder sitting next to the Eclipse.app should be in the Contents folder.
Fix released for builds < 20060407-1700.

Thanks for trying to fix. Unfortunately, the executables are still not generated correctly. For Linux and Windows exports, there is no more binaries at all (only the plugins, features and configuration folders). 
As for the mac export there is an empty package named "AppName.app" alongside the folders but it is not executable either as its size is of 0 Ko...

I am using eclipse-SDK-N20060408-0010 along with a target made of eclipse-RCP-SDK-N20060408-0010 and the eclipse-RCP-N20060408-0010 on Mac OS X 10.4.6 using Java 1.4.2.
To correctly export you need to have the delta pack installed in your target. It seems that you do not have it.

I have the delta-pack installed in my target. If you don't you will not be able to choose "export to multiple plateforms". 
Can you reproduce this bug ?

I have tried to reproduce the problem with M6 from a windows machine exporting on the multiple platforms. Everything worked to the exception of the problem in the delta pack reported here, but when I fixed it everything was fine. Could you please give detailed steps on how to reproduce the pb?

One problem may be that the target.build.properties should be renamed to build.properties in the org.eclipse.platform.launcher feature.  I will investigate why this is failing  at build time.

Hello,
I had the opportunity to test this on a windows machine with the exact same configuration (3.2RC1)... and the mac output obtained on this machine is working perfectly on a mac. This is with no name specified for the Launcher name, if you specify a name for the Launcher, it will result in the problem described in commment #9

I will try again tomorrow on the mac machine and let you know if the problem described in comment #14 is specific to the mac or if it was a transitory bug...

Ok found the problem. 
It is a problem specific on the mac plateform (didn't tried in linux though). If you export to mac on a mac plateform, the file "appfolder/eclipse/Contents/MacOS/eclipse" is set as a "document" type instead of a Unix (universal) executable. If you export to mac from a Windows machine, the same file will be a Unix (universal) executable, that's why it is working.

Notice that these files have both the exact same size. If I replace the "document" one by the "Unix executable" one everything works perfectly well.

To illustrate this better please refer to the attachment following (The first "eclipse" file is from the mac export done on a windows machine and the second "eclipse" file from the mac export done on a mac machine")

I tried to erase and downloaded/reinstall the whole 3.2RC1 on my mac without any success, having still the same issue

Created an attachment (id=38659)
Properties of the "appfolder/eclipse/Contents/MacOS/eclipse" file

The first "eclipse" file is from the mac export done on a windows machine and the second "eclipse" file from the mac export done on a mac machine"
The bugs described in comment 9 and 16/17 are still there in build 20060425... is someone looking into this ?
Be insured that this will be fixed for 3.2. Andrew had to work on some other important stuffs for callisto and I was away for a while.

The problem from comment 9 is the result of several new files added to the mac launcher since 3.1 that the pde.build branding does not know about so they do not get moved over to the new <launcherName>.app directory and get left in the Eclipse.app.  

As well, the Info.plist file is not getting its contents replaced correctly and the ini file has a reference to the icns file that will also need be be replaced.

Created an attachment (id=39822)
patch

Using build I20060428-0010 with the delta pack from that same build, and the attached patch, I was able to successfully run an exported RCP app in the 2 cases:
export for mac from a windows machine
export for mac from a mac machine

The patch will be released for RC3. In the meantime I would appreciate if you could test if your scenario is working with the attached version of pde build.
Note that you need to delete the previous version of pde build and start with -clean.

Ok I replaced the plugin folder org.eclipse.pde.build in /Eclipse/Plugins by the patched one. I started Eclipse with -clean (added -clean in the eclipe.ini file)... and tried a multiple plateform export. Actually sorry to say that it is worse. There is no more "eclipse.app" at all in the mac output ! This is if I don't specify a launcher name.

If I specify a launcher name, there is a "application.app" folder in the mac output but without anything in the /Contents/MacOS and /Contents/Resources folder.

This is with Eclipse 3.2 RC2, target with RCP-SDK 3.2RC2 and delta-pack 3.2RC2 on a windows xp machine, java 1.4.2.
 
I didn't had the opportunity to test on my mac yet. Will let you know...

Maybe I should wait for the next "Stream Integration Build" replacing the whole installation with the new build.

I have been unable to reproduce your problem by exporting a Hello RCP app created with the New Plugin-Project wizard, using the following setups:
-Eclipse SDK 3.2RC2 + attached PDE.build + delta pack RC2
-Eclipse SDK 3.2RC2 + attached PDE.build with target as Eclipse RCP 3.2RC2 + delta pack RC2

Windows XP, Java 1.4.2 & Java 1.5

I have however made a small change to the patch

Created an attachment (id=39948)
updated pde.build containing new patch

Updated pde.build containing new patch

Ok found out what the problem is !
It is because my output folder has got a space in its name (ie MedClipse Binaries) !!
If the path to the output folder doesn't have a space (ie MedClipse_Binaries) everything works well.

If there is a space in the name of the output folder, the file described in comment #17 , has "document" as type. If there is no space in the name of the output folder the file has got "unix executable" as a type.

This is on Mac OS X 10.4.6 Java 1.5.0 Eclipse 3.2 RC2 with target made of RCP-SDK and delta-pack 3.2RC2.

I will  have to test again on windows tomorrow. Maybe you can reproduce this "space" problem on windows too...
Oh yeah and by the way, changing the launcher name works now too.

We are getting close...
Thanks !

Ok sorry... I don't know what happened yesterday.

I tested again and time it worked without any problem with your latest patch, even in an output folder containing spaces in the name and even if a launcher name was defined. I tested only on a mac.

The only problem that I've noticed is that the icon of the application is not the eclipse generic one as it used to be before (I didn't specified an icon in Launcher section of app.product). This is a minor problem... See attached pdf for a visual explanation.
What you are seeing here is normal, many people don't want to provide an icon and don't want to see the eclipse icon. Therefore we do not provide any icon to make eveybody happy :-)
